node.title: Tourist killed by shark in popular snorkeling spot
node.description: The 56-year-old man was swimming near a cliff when he was bitten by the shark.
node.content: ["An Italian tourist died Friday after being attacked by a shark off the coast of Colombia's San Andres island in the Caribbean Sea, local media reported. The 56-year-old man, identified by Colombian press as Antonio Roseto Degli Abruzzi, was swimming near a cliff when he was bitten by the shark.", "\"Yes, he died,\" a senior Navy official, who asked to remain anonymous, told AFP.", "The Teleislas channel said the unusual attack took place in an area known as \"La Piscinita,\" a popular snorkeling area on the southwest side of San Andres, which is about 235 miles off the coast of Nicaragua.", "The shark attack occurred in an area with few swimmers, local media said.", "Marine biologist Rodrigo Lopez\u00a0told\u00a0The Daily Mirror that \"people are very worried\" after the attack.", "The Archipielago Press reported that a tiger shark was responsible for the attack and on Twitter posted video of sharks in the water.", "Estos dos tiburones tigrillos son los dos escualos que esta tarde atacaron a un turista extranjero en el sector de La Piscinita, caus\u00e1ndole la muerte. En las dos \u00faltimas semanas han aparecido tiburones en aguas poco profundas al norte y sur de San Andr\u00e9s pic.twitter.com/NrrdHO74Qb", "\"In the last two weeks, sharks have appeared in shallow waters north and south of San Andr\u00e9s,\" the Archipielago Press said in the post.", "Shark attacks increased around the world in 2021 following three consecutive years of decline, according to data released in January.\u00a0 Researchers with the\u00a0International Shark Attack File\u00a0recorded 73 unprovoked incidents last year, compared to 52 bites in 2020, according to the report. ", "The U.S. again reported the most unprovoked shark bites in 2021, with 47 confirmed cases -- 64% of the worldwide total. Colombia reported no shark attacks last year, according to the International Shark Attack File."]
